instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> can not see hard drive
threads.message: I've got a 2009 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP that doesn't see the hard drive.  Normally when these come in and the hard drive is still good it's the 821-0814 interconnect cable that's gone bad.  This is the first one I've seen where the drive is good and the interconnect cable is good but the system still doesn't see the hard drive.  Can anyone point me in the right direction ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> can not see hard drive
threads.message: HDD spinning up? If yes check for damaged FL4501/02, <CAPACITOR>C4510</CAPACITOR>,11,15,16.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> can not see hard drive
threads.message: FL4502 was dead on 3-4 , replaced and now system sees the drive again.  Thank you for the quick help on this one.
